Other animals

Under the Animal Act 1971 the Council can impound any livestock which has strayed onto Council land.
The animals are only returned to their owners after payment for any damages and expenses incurred.
Livestock that has strayed onto private land may also be impounded
column2: at the written request of the landowner.
the owner of the animal will be informed that the animal has strayed onto Council land
